body_content.explanation: the crime of intentionally killing a person:
examples: Two sisters have been charged with (= officially accused of) murder.
There were three murders in the town last year.
The three were convicted of (= proved guilty of) murder.
a murder weapon (= a weapon used to commit a murder)

body_content.explanation: a group of crows (= large black birds):
examples: The crow's association with death as a result of its tendency to scavenge on the battlefield probably led to the sinister term 'murder of crows'.

body_content.explanation: to commit the crime of intentionally killing a person:
examples: Her husband was murdered by gunmen as she watched.
In the last year, terrorists have murdered several local journalists.

body_content.explanation: If you say you will or could murder someone, you mean you are very angry with them:
examples: If he's late again, I'll murder him!

body_content.explanation: to do or perform something very badly, so that you spoil it completely:
examples: karaoke singers who murder pop classics
